service: The operations for managing an Amazon MSK cluster.

operations.BatchAssociateScramSecret: Associates one or more Scram Secrets with an Amazon MSK cluster.
operations.CreateClusterV2: Creates a new Amazon MSK cluster of either the provisioned or the serverless type.
operations.CreateVpcConnection: Creates a new Amazon MSK VPC connection.
operations.DeleteCluster: Deletes the MSK cluster specified by the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) in the request.
operations.DeleteClusterPolicy: Deletes the MSK cluster policy specified by the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) in your request.
operations.DeleteConfiguration: Deletes the specified MSK configuration. The configuration must be in the ACTIVE or DELETE_FAILED state.
operations.DeleteVpcConnection: Deletes the Amazon MSK VPC connection specified in your request.
operations.DescribeCluster: Returns a description of the MSK cluster whose Amazon Resource Name (ARN) is specified in the request.
operations.DescribeClusterV2: Returns a description of the MSK cluster of either the provisioned or the serverless type whose Amazon Resource Name (ARN) is specified in the request.
operations.DescribeClusterOperation: Returns a description of the cluster operation specified by the ARN.
operations.DescribeConfiguration: Returns a description of this MSK configuration.
operations.DescribeConfigurationRevision: Returns a description of this revision of the configuration.
operations.DescribeVpcConnection: Displays information about the specified Amazon MSK VPC connection.
operations.BatchDisassociateScramSecret: Disassociates one or more Scram Secrets from an Amazon MSK cluster.
operations.GetBootstrapBrokers: A list of brokers that a client application can use to bootstrap.
operations.GetCompatibleKafkaVersions: Gets the Apache Kafka versions to which you can update the MSK cluster.
operations.GetClusterPolicy: Retrieves the contents of the specified MSK cluster policy.
operations.ListClientVpcConnections: Displays a list of client VPC connections.
operations.ListClusterOperations: Returns a list of all the operations that have been performed on the specified MSK cluster.
operations.ListClusters: Returns a list of all the MSK clusters in the current Region.
operations.ListClustersV2: Returns a list of all the MSK clusters in the current Region.
operations.ListConfigurationRevisions: Returns a list of all the revisions of an MSK configuration.
operations.ListConfigurations: Returns a list of all the MSK configurations in this Region.
operations.ListKafkaVersions: Returns a list of Apache Kafka versions.
operations.ListNodes: Returns a list of the broker nodes in the cluster.
operations.ListScramSecrets: Returns a list of the Scram Secrets associated with an Amazon MSK cluster.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Returns a list of the tags associated with the specified resource.
operations.ListVpcConnections: Displays a list of Amazon MSK VPC connections.
operations.PutClusterPolicy: Creates or updates the specified MSK cluster policy. If updating the policy, the currentVersion field is required in the request payload.
operations.TagResource: Adds tags to the specified MSK resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes the tags associated with the keys that are provided in the query.
operations.UpdateBrokerCount: Updates the number of broker nodes in the cluster. You can use this operation to increase the number of brokers in an existing cluster. You can't decrease the number of brokers.
operations.UpdateBrokerType: Updates all the brokers in the cluster to the specified type.
operations.UpdateBrokerStorage: Updates the EBS storage associated with MSK brokers.
operations.UpdateConfiguration: Updates an existing MSK configuration. The configuration must be in the Active state.
operations.UpdateConnectivity: Updates the connectivity configuration for the MSK cluster.
operations.UpdateClusterConfiguration: Updates the cluster with the configuration that is specified in the request body.
operations.UpdateClusterKafkaVersion: Updates the Apache Kafka version for the cluster.
operations.UpdateMonitoring: Updates the monitoring settings for the cluster. You can use this operation to specify which Apache Kafka metrics you want Amazon MSK to send to Amazon CloudWatch. You can also specify settings for open monitoring with Prometheus.
operations.UpdateSecurity: You can use this operation to update the encrypting and authentication settings for an existing cluster.
operations.UpdateStorage: Updates cluster broker volume size (or) sets cluster storage mode to TIERED.

BrokerAZDistribution.base: The distribution of broker nodes across Availability Zones. By default, broker nodes are distributed among the Availability Zones of your Region. Currently, the only supported value is DEFAULT. You can either specify this value explicitly or leave it out.

refs.BrokerNodeGroupInfo$BrokerAZDistribution: The distribution of broker nodes across Availability Zones.

BrokerEBSVolumeInfo.base: Specifies the EBS volume upgrade information. The broker identifier must be set to the keyword ALL. This means the changes apply to all the brokers in the cluster.

BrokerLogs.base: The broker logs configuration for this MSK cluster.

refs.LoggingInfo$BrokerLogs: You can configure your MSK cluster to send broker logs to different destination types. This configuration specifies the details of these destinations.

BrokerNodeGroupInfo.base: Describes the setup to be used for Apache Kafka broker nodes in the cluster.

refs.Serverless$ClientAuthentication: Information about the serverless cluster client authentication.
refs.ServerlessRequest$ClientAuthentication: Information about the serverless cluster client authentication.

BrokerSoftwareInfo.base: Information about the current software installed on the cluster.

refs.BrokerNodeInfo$CurrentBrokerSoftwareInfo: Information about the version of software currently deployed on the Apache Kafka brokers in the cluster.
refs.ClusterInfo$CurrentBrokerSoftwareInfo: Information about the version of software currently deployed on the Apache Kafka brokers in the cluster.
refs.Provisioned$CurrentBrokerSoftwareInfo: Information about the version of software currently deployed on the Apache Kafka brokers in the cluster.

refs.EncryptionInTransit$ClientBroker:
Indicates the encryption setting for data in transit between clients and brokers. You must set it to one of the following values.

TLS means that client-broker communication is enabled with TLS only.

TLS_PLAINTEXT means that client-broker communication is enabled for both TLS-encrypted, as well as plaintext data.

PLAINTEXT means that client-broker communication is enabled in plaintext only.

The default value is TLS.

CloudWatchLogs.base: Details of the CloudWatch Logs destination for broker logs.

refs.BrokerLogs$CloudWatchLogs: Details of the CloudWatch Logs destination for broker logs.

Cluster.base: Returns information about a cluster of either the provisioned or the serverless type.

refs.ClusterOperationStep$StepInfo: Information about the step and its status.

ClusterState.base: The state of an Apache Kafka cluster.

refs.ClusterInfo$State: The state of the cluster. The possible states are ACTIVE, CREATING, DELETING, FAILED, HEALING, MAINTENANCE, REBOOTING_BROKER, and UPDATING.
refs.CreateClusterResponse$State: The state of the cluster. The possible states are ACTIVE, CREATING, DELETING, FAILED, HEALING, MAINTENANCE, REBOOTING_BROKER, and UPDATING.
refs.CreateClusterV2Response$State: The state of the cluster. The possible states are ACTIVE, CREATING, DELETING, FAILED, HEALING, MAINTENANCE, REBOOTING_BROKER, and UPDATING.
refs.DeleteClusterResponse$State: The state of the cluster. The possible states are ACTIVE, CREATING, DELETING, FAILED, HEALING, MAINTENANCE, REBOOTING_BROKER, and UPDATING.

CompatibleKafkaVersion.base: Contains source Apache Kafka versions and compatible target Apache Kafka versions.

ConfigurationInfo.base: Specifies the configuration to use for the brokers.

refs.CreateClusterRequest$ConfigurationInfo: Represents the configuration that you want MSK to use for the cluster.
refs.ProvisionedRequest$ConfigurationInfo: Represents the configuration that you want MSK to use for the cluster.
refs.MutableClusterInfo$ConfigurationInfo: Information about the changes in the configuration of the brokers.
refs.UpdateClusterConfigurationRequest$Config: Represents the configuration that you want MSK to use for the cluster.

refs.DescribeConfigurationResponse$State: The state of the configuration. The possible states are ACTIVE, DELETING and DELETE_FAILED.
refs.CreateConfigurationResponse$State: The state of the configuration. The possible states are ACTIVE, DELETING and DELETE_FAILED.
refs.DeleteConfigurationResponse$State: The state of the configuration. The possible states are ACTIVE, DELETING and DELETE_FAILED.

CreateClusterV2Request.base: Creates a new Amazon MSK cluster of either the provisioned or the serverless type.

CreateClusterV2Response.base: Returns information about the created cluster of either the provisioned or the serverless type.

DescribeClusterV2Response.base: Returns information about a cluster of either the provisioned or the serverless type.

EBSStorageInfo.base: Contains information about the EBS storage volumes attached to Apache Kafka broker nodes.

EncryptionInTransit.base: The settings for encrypting data in transit.

EncryptionInfo.base: Includes encryption-related information, such as the AWS KMS key used for encrypting data at rest and whether you want MSK to encrypt your data in transit.

EnhancedMonitoring.base: Specifies which metrics are gathered for the MSK cluster. This property has the following possible values: DEFAULT, PER_BROKER, PER_TOPIC_PER_BROKER, and PER_TOPIC_PER_PARTITION. For a list of the metrics associated with each of these levels of monitoring, see Monitoring.

refs.ClusterInfo$EnhancedMonitoring: Specifies which metrics are gathered for the MSK cluster. This property has the following possible values: DEFAULT, PER_BROKER, PER_TOPIC_PER_BROKER, and PER_TOPIC_PER_PARTITION. For a list of the metrics associated with each of these levels of monitoring, see Monitoring.
refs.Provisioned$EnhancedMonitoring: Specifies which metrics are gathered for the MSK cluster. This property has the following possible values: DEFAULT, PER_BROKER, PER_TOPIC_PER_BROKER, and PER_TOPIC_PER_PARTITION. For a list of the metrics associated with each of these levels of monitoring, see Monitoring.
refs.CreateClusterRequest$EnhancedMonitoring: Specifies the level of monitoring for the MSK cluster. The possible values are DEFAULT, PER_BROKER, PER_TOPIC_PER_BROKER, and PER_TOPIC_PER_PARTITION.
refs.ProvisionedRequest$EnhancedMonitoring: Specifies the level of monitoring for the MSK cluster. The possible values are DEFAULT, PER_BROKER, PER_TOPIC_PER_BROKER, and PER_TOPIC_PER_PARTITION.
refs.MutableClusterInfo$EnhancedMonitoring: Specifies which Apache Kafka metrics Amazon MSK gathers and sends to Amazon CloudWatch for this cluster.
refs.UpdateMonitoringRequest$EnhancedMonitori: Specifies which Apache Kafka metrics Amazon MSK gathers and sends to Amazon CloudWatch for this cluster.

ErrorInfo.base: Returns information about an error state of the cluster.

refs.ClusterOperationInfo$ErrorInfo: Describes the error if the operation fails.

refs.BrokerLogs$Firehose: Details of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for broker logs.

GetBootstrapBrokersResponse.base: Returns a string containing one or more hostname:port pairs.

GetClusterPolicyResponse.base: Returns information about the specified cluster policy.

JmxExporter.base: Indicates whether you want to enable or disable the JMX Exporter.

refs.Prometheus$JmxExporter: Indicates whether you want to enable or disable the JMX Exporter.

JmxExporterInfo.base: Indicates whether you want to enable or disable the JMX Exporter.

KafkaVersionStatus.base: The status of a Apache Kafka version.

refs.KafkaVersion$Status: The status of the Apache Kafka version.

ListClusterOperationsResponse.base: The response contains an array containing cluster operation information and a next token if the response is truncated.

ListClustersResponse.base: The response contains an array containing cluster information and a next token if the response is truncated.

ListClustersV2Response.base: The response contains an array containing cluster information and a next token if the response is truncated.

ListConfigurationRevisionsResponse.base: Information about revisions of an MSK configuration.

ListConfigurationsResponse.base: The response contains an array of Configuration and a next token if the response is truncated.

ListScramSecretsResponse.base: Information about scram secrets associated to the cluster.

ListTagsForResourceResponse.base: Response of listing tags for a resource.

ListClientVpcConnectionsResponse.base: The response contains an array of client VPC connections and a next token if the response is truncated.

ListVpcConnectionsResponse.base: The response contains an array of MSK VPC connections and a next token if the response is truncated.

LoggingInfo.base: You can configure your MSK cluster to send broker logs to different destination types. This is a container for the configuration details related to broker logs.

refs.ClusterInfo$LoggingInfo: You can configure your MSK cluster to send broker logs to different destination types. This is a container for the configuration details related to broker logs.
refs.Provisioned$LoggingInfo: You can configure your MSK cluster to send broker logs to different destination types. This is a container for the configuration details related to broker logs.

MutableClusterInfo.base: Information about cluster attributes that can be updated via update APIs.

refs.ClusterOperationInfo$SourceClusterInfo: Information about cluster attributes before a cluster is updated.
refs.ClusterOperationInfo$TargetClusterInfo: Information about cluster attributes after a cluster is updated.

NodeExporter.base: Indicates whether you want to enable or disable the Node Exporter.

refs.Prometheus$NodeExporter: Indicates whether you want to enable or disable the Node Exporter.

NodeExporterInfo.base: Indicates whether you want to enable or disable the Node Exporter.

OpenMonitoring.base: JMX and Node monitoring for the MSK cluster.

OpenMonitoringInfo.base: JMX and Node monitoring for the MSK cluster.

ProvisionedThroughput.base: Contains information about provisioned throughput for EBS storage volumes attached to kafka broker nodes.

S3.base: The details of the Amazon S3 destination for broker logs.

refs.BrokerLogs$S3: Details of the Amazon S3 destination for broker logs.

StateInfo.base: Contains information about the state of the Amazon MSK cluster.

refs.ClusterInfo$StateInfo: Contains information about the state of the Amazon MSK cluster.

StorageInfo.base: Contains information about storage volumes attached to MSK broker nodes.

refs.BrokerNodeGroupInfo$StorageInfo: Contains information about storage volumes attached to MSK broker nodes.

StorageMode.base: Controls storage mode for various supported storage tiers.

refs.Provisioned$StorageMode: This controls storage mode for supported storage tiers.
refs.ProvisionedRequest$StorageMode: This controls storage mode for supported storage tiers.
refs.ClusterInfo$StorageMode: This controls storage mode for supported storage tiers.
refs.CreateClusterRequest$StorageMode: This controls storage mode for supported storage tiers.
refs.MutableClusterInfo$StorageMode: This controls storage mode for supported storage tiers.
refs.UpdateStorageRequest$StorageMode: Controls storage mode for supported storage tiers.

Unauthenticated.base: Contains information about unauthenticated traffic to the cluster.

refs.ClientAuthentication$Unauthenticated: Contains information about unauthenticated traffic to the cluster.

UserIdentity.base: Description of the requester that calls the API operation.

refs.VpcConnectionInfo$UserIdentity: Description of the requester that calls the API operation.

UserIdentityType.base: The identity type of the requester that calls the API operation.

refs.UserIdentity$Type: The identity type of the requester that calls the API operation.

VpcConfig.base: The configuration of the Amazon VPCs for the cluster.

VpcConnectionInfo.base: Description of the VPC connection for CreateVpcConnection and DeleteVpcConnection operations.

refs.ClusterOperationInfo$VpcConnectionInfo: Description of the VPC connection for CreateVpcConnection and DeleteVpcConnection operations.

refs.DescribeVpcConnectionResponse$State: The state of the VPC connection. The possible states are AVAILABLE, INACTIVE, DEACTIVATING, DELETING, CREATING, REJECTING, REJECTED and FAILED.
refs.CreateVpcConnectionResponse$State: The state of the VPC connection. The only possible state is CREATING.
refs.DeleteVpcConnectionResponse$State: The state of the VPC connection. The only possible state is DELETING.

refs.CloudWatchLogs$Enabled: Specifies whether broker logs get sent to the specified CloudWatch Logs destination.
refs.EncryptionInTransit$InCluster:
When set to true, it indicates that data communication among the broker nodes of the cluster is encrypted. When set to false, the communication happens in plaintext.

The default value is true.
refs.Firehose$Enabled: Specifies whether broker logs get sent to the specified Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream.
refs.JmxExporter$EnabledInBroker: Indicates whether you want to enable or disable the JMX Exporter.
refs.NodeExporter$EnabledInBroker: Indicates whether you want to enable or disable the Node Exporter.
refs.S3$Enabled: Specifies whether broker logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3 destination.
refs.Unauthenticated$Enabled: Specifies whether you want to enable or disable unauthenticated traffic to your cluster.
refs.VpcConnectivityIAM$Enabled: SASL/IAM authentication for VPC connectivity is on or off.
refs.VpcConnectivityScram$Enabled: SASL/SCRAM authentication for VPC connectivity is on or off.
refs.VpcConnectivityTls$Enabled: TLS authentication for VPC connectivity is on or off.

refs.BrokerEBSVolumeInfo$VolumeSizeGB: Size of the EBS volume to update.
refs.ClusterInfo$NumberOfBrokerNodes: The number of broker nodes in the cluster.
refs.CreateClusterRequest$NumberOfBrokerNodes: The number of broker nodes in the cluster.
refs.MutableClusterInfo$NumberOfBrokerNodes: The number of broker nodes in the cluster.
refs.ProvisionedThroughput$VolumeThroughput: Throughput value of the EBS volumes for the data drive on each kafka broker node in MiB per second.
refs.UpdateStorageRequest$VolumeSizeGB: size of the EBS volume to update.

refs.CreateClusterRequest$NumberOfBrokerNodes: The number of Apache Kafka broker nodes in the Amazon MSK cluster.
refs.UpdateBrokerCountRequest$TargetNumberOfB: The number of broker nodes that you want the cluster to have after this operation completes successfully.

refs.EBSStorageInfo$VolumeSize: The size in GiB of the EBS volume for the data drive on each broker node.

refs.MutableClusterInfo$BrokerEBSVolumeInfo: Specifies the size of the EBS volume and the ID of the associated broker.
refs.UpdateBrokerStorageRequest$TargetBrokerE:
Describes the target volume size and the ID of the broker to apply the update to.

The value you specify for Target-Volume-in-GiB must be a whole number that is greater than 100 GiB.

The storage per broker after the update operation can't exceed 16384 GiB.

refs.ListClustersResponse$ClusterInfoList: Information on each of the MSK clusters in the response.

refs.ListClustersV2Response$ClusterInfoList: Information on each of the MSK clusters in the response.

refs.ServerlessRequest$VpcConfigs: Information on vpc config for the serverless cluster.
refs.Serverless$VpcConfigs: Information on vpc config for the serverless cluster.

refs.ListClusterOperationsResponse$ClusterOpe: An array of cluster operation information objects.

refs.ListKafkaVersionsResponse$KafkaVersions: An array of Apache Kafka version objects.

refs.BatchAssociateScramSecretResponse$Unproc: List of errors when associating secrets to cluster.
refs.BatchDisassociateScramSecretResponse$Unp: List of errors when disassociating secrets to cluster.

refs.BatchAssociateScramSecretRequest$SecretA: List of AWS Secrets Manager secret ARNs.
refs.BatchDisassociateScramSecretRequest$Secr: List of AWS Secrets Manager secret ARNs.
refs.BrokerNodeGroupInfo$ClientSubnets: The list of subnets to connect to in the client virtual private cloud (VPC). AWS creates elastic network interfaces inside these subnets. Client applications use elastic network interfaces to produce and consume data. Client subnets can't occupy the Availability Zone with ID use use1-az3.
refs.BrokerNodeGroupInfo$SecurityGroups: The AWS security groups to associate with the elastic network interfaces in order to specify who can connect to and communicate with the Amazon MSK cluster. If you don't specify a security group, Amazon MSK uses the default security group associated with the VPC. If you specify security groups that were shared with you, you must ensure that you have permissions to them. Specifically, you need the ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups permission.
refs.Configuration$KafkaVersions: An array of the versions of Apache Kafka with which you can use this MSK configuration. You can use this configuration for an MSK cluster only if the Apache Kafka version specified for the cluster appears in this array.
refs.CreateConfigurationRequest$KafkaVersions: The versions of Apache Kafka with which you can use this MSK configuration.
refs.CreateVpcConnectionRequest$ClientSubnets: The list of subnets in the client VPC.
refs.CreateVpcConnectionRequest$SecurityGroup: The list of security groups to attach to the VPC connection.
refs.CreateVpcConnectionResponse$ClientSubnet: The list of subnets in the client VPC.
refs.CreateVpcConnectionResponse$SecurityGrou: The list of security groups attached to the VPC connection.
refs.DescribeConfigurationResponse$KafkaVersi: The versions of Apache Kafka with which you can use this MSK configuration.
refs.DescribeVpcConnectionResponse$SecurityGr: The list of security groups attached to the VPC connection.
refs.DescribeVpcConnectionResponse$Subnets: The list of subnets in the client VPC.
refs.ListScramSecretsResponse$SecretArnList: The list of scram secrets associated with the cluster.
refs.RebootBrokerRequest$BrokerIds: The list of broker ids to be rebooted.

refs.BrokerSoftwareInfo$ConfigurationRevision: The revision of the configuration to use. This field isn't visible in this preview release.
refs.ConfigurationInfo$Revision: The revision of the configuration to use.

refs.CreateVpcConnectionRequest$Tags: Create tags when creating the VPC connection.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$Tags: The key-value pair for the resource tag.
refs.TagResourceRequest$Tags: The key-value pair for the resource tag.

refs.BatchAssociateScramSecretResponse$Cluste: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
refs.BatchDisassociateScramSecretResponse$Clu: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
refs.BrokerEBSVolumeInfo$KafkaBrokerNodeId: The ID of the broker to update.
refs.BrokerNodeInfo$AttachedENIId: The attached elastic network interface of the broker.
refs.BrokerNodeInfo$ClientSubnet: The client subnet to which this broker node belongs.
refs.BrokerNodeInfo$ClientVpcIpAddress: The virtual private cloud (VPC) of the client.
refs.BrokerSoftwareInfo$ConfigurationArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configuration used for the cluster. This field isn't visible in this preview release.
refs.ClientVpcConnection$VpcConnectionArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the VPC connection.
refs.CloudWatchLogs$LogGroup: The CloudWatch log group that is the destination for broker logs.
refs.ClusterInfo$ClusterArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the cluster.
refs.ClusterInfo$CurrentVersion: The current version of the MSK cluster. Cluster versions aren't simple integers. You can obtain the current version by describing the cluster. An example version is KTVPDKIKX0DER.
refs.ClusterInfo$ZookeeperConnectString: The connection string to use to connect to the Apache ZooKeeper cluster.
refs.ClusterInfo$ZookeeperConnectStringTls: The connection string to use to connect to zookeeper cluster on Tls port.
refs.ClusterOperationInfo$ClientRequestId: The ID of the API request that triggered this operation.
refs.Configuration$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configuration.
refs.Configuration$Name: The name of the configuration. Configuration names are strings that match the regex "^[0-9A-Za-z-]+$".
refs.CreateClusterResponse$ClusterArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
refs.CreateConfigurationRequest$Name: The name of the configuration. Configuration names are strings that match the regex "^[0-9A-Za-z-]+$".
refs.CreateConfigurationResponse$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configuration.
refs.CreateConfigurationResponse$Name: The name of the configuration. Configuration names are strings that match the regex "^[0-9A-Za-z-]+$".
refs.CreateVpcConnectionRequest$TargetCluster: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
refs.CreateVpcConnectionRequest$VpcId: The VPC ID of the VPC connection.
refs.CreateVpcConnectionResponse$VpcConnectio: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the VPC connection.
refs.CreateVpcConnectionResponse$VpcId: The VPC ID of the VPC connection.
refs.DeleteClusterResponse$ClusterArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
refs.DeleteConfigurationRequest$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configuration.
refs.DeleteConfigurationResponse$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configuration.
refs.DeleteVpcConnectionResponse$VpcConnectio: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the VPC connection.
refs.DescribeConfigurationResponse$Arn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configuration.
refs.DescribeConfigurationResponse$Name: The name of the configuration. Configuration names are strings that match the regex "^[0-9A-Za-z-]+$".
refs.DescribeConfigurationRevisionResponse$Ar: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the configuration.
refs.DescribeVpcConnectionResponse$Authentica: The authentication type of the VPC connection.
refs.DescribeVpcConnectionResponse$TargetClus: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
refs.DescribeVpcConnectionResponse$VpcConnect: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the VPC connection.
refs.DescribeVpcConnectionResponse$VpcId: The VPC ID of the VPC connection.
refs.EncryptionAtRest$DataVolumeKMSKeyId: The ARN of the AWS KMS key for encrypting data at rest. If you don't specify a KMS key, MSK creates one for you and uses it.
refs.ErrorInfo$ErrorString: An optional field to provide more details about the error.
refs.Firehose$DeliveryStream: The Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for broker logs.
refs.GetBootstrapBrokersResponse$BootstrapBro: A string containing one or more hostname:port pairs.

A string containing one or more DNS names (or IP addresses) and TLS port pairs. The following is an example.

{ "BootstrapBrokerStringTls": "b-3.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9094,b-1.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9094,b-2.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9094" }

A string containing one or more DNS names (or IP addresses) and SASL SCRAM port pairs. The following is an example.

{ "BootstrapBrokerStringSaslScram": "b-3.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9096,b-1.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9096,b-2.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9096" }

A string that contains one or more DNS names (or IP addresses) and SASL IAM port pairs. The following is an example.

{ "BootstrapBrokerStringSaslIam": "b-3.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9098,b-1.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9098,b-2.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9098" }

A string containing one or more DNS names (or IP addresses) and TLS port pairs. The following is an example.

{ "BootstrapBrokerStringTls": "b-3.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9194,b-1.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9194,b-2.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9194" }

A string containing one or more DNS names (or IP addresses) and SASL SCRAM port pairs. The following is an example.

{ "BootstrapBrokerStringSaslScram": "b-3.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9196,b-1.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9196,b-2.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9196" }

A string that contains one or more DNS names (or IP addresses) and SASL IAM port pairs. The following is an example.

{ "BootstrapBrokerStringSaslIam": "b-3.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9198,b-1.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9198,b-2.exampleClusterName.abcde.c2.kafka.us-east-1.amazonaws.com:9198" }
A string containing one or more dns name (or IP) and SASL IAM port pairs for VPC connectivity.
A string containing one or more dns name (or IP) and SASL SCRAM port pairs for VPC connectivity.
A string containing one or more dns name (or IP) and Tls port pairs for VPC connectivity.
refs.GetClusterPolicyResponse$Policy: Cluster policy attached to the MSK cluster.
refs.ListClientVpcConnectionsResponse$NextTok: If the response of ListClientVpcConnections is truncated, it returns a NextToken in the response. This Nexttoken should be sent in the subsequent request to ListClientVpcConnections.
refs.ListClusterOperationsResponse$NextToken: If the response of ListClusterOperations is truncated, it returns a NextToken in the response. This Nexttoken should be sent in the subsequent request to ListClusterOperations.
refs.ListClustersResponse$NextToken: The paginated results marker. When the result of a ListClusters operation is truncated, the call returns NextToken in the response. To get another batch of clusters, provide this token in your next request.
refs.ListConfigurationsResponse$NextToken: The paginated results marker. When the result of a ListConfigurations operation is truncated, the call returns NextToken in the response. To get another batch of configurations, provide this token in your next request.
refs.ListNodesResponse$NextToken: The paginated results marker. When the result of a ListNodes operation is truncated, the call returns NextToken in the response. To get another batch of nodes, provide this token in your next request.
refs.ListVpcConnectionsResponse$NextToken: If the response of ListVpcConnections is truncated, it returns a NextToken in the response. This NextToken should be sent in the subsequent request to ListVpcConnections.
refs.NodeInfo$NodeARN: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the node.
refs.PublicAccess$Type: The value DISABLED indicates that public access is disabled. SERVICE_PROVIDED_EIPS indicates that public access is enabled.
refs.RebootBrokerResponse$ClusterArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
refs.RebootBrokerResponse$ClusterOperationArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster operation.
refs.S3$Bucket: The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for broker logs.
refs.S3$Prefix: The S3 prefix that is the destination for broker logs.
refs.StateInfo$Code: If the cluster is in an unusable state, this field contains the code that describes the issue.
refs.StateInfo$Message: If the cluster is in an unusable state, this field contains a message that describes the issue.
refs.UpdateBrokerCountResponse$ClusterArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.
refs.UpdateBrokerCountResponse$ClusterOperati: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster operation.
